text: Pursuant to the New York State Public Service Commission’s (Commission) 2023 Order
Providing Guidance on Development of Utility Thermal Energy Network Pilot Projects (Guidance
Order),1 Consolidated Edison Company of New York, Inc. (Con Edison or the Company) submits
this Monthly Progress and Expenditure Report detailing the Company’s Utility Thermal Energy
Network (UTEN) pilot projects’ status and associated expenditures.
The Company is managing a portfolio of three pilot projects: Chelsea, Mount Vernon, and
Rockefeller Center. These projects will test the use of UTENs to generate benefits and maximize
learning opportunities in four areas: emissions reduction in alignment with the Climate Leadership
and Community Protection Act (CLCPA);2 reduction of electric system infrastructure investments
and customer costs to electrify buildings; equity and access to clean energy solutions in
disadvantaged communities; and a just transition for the gas and local workforce. Summaries of
expenditures associated with each project and the overarching portfolio are provided in Table 1.
Table 1: Summary of Project Expenditures to Date and Forecasted Project Costs

1 Case 22-M-0429, Proceeding on Motion of the Commission to Implement the Requirements of the Utility Thermal 
Energy Network and Jobs Act (Thermal Energy Network Proceeding), Order Providing Guidance on Development 
of Utility Thermal Energy Network Pilot Projects (issued September 14, 2023) (Guidance Order). 
2 Laws of 2019, Chapter 106 (enacted June 18, 2019). 
3 Forecasted Project Budget includes previously proposed contingency costs.  
4 Portfolio administration costs include, but are not limited to, incremental labor, support services, program 
management, and data management. Portfolio administration costs exclude consulting, engineering, construction, 
and legal services. As shown in Tables 3, 5, and 7, the Company is illustrating project-specific administrative costs 
by dividing the total portfolio administrative costs by the number of projects (3).
